head.title: Breeders Is Finale For Lemon Drop Kid

hedline.hl1: Breeders Is Finale For Lemon Drop Kid

abstract.p: Lemon Drop Kid will be retired after Breeders' Cup Classic Nov 4 (S)

block.p: Lemon Drop Kid, who won the Belmont and Travers Stakes last year and who is a leading candidate for Horse of the Year this year, will stand at Lane's End Farm in Kentucky when he is retired after the Breeders' Cup Classic Nov. 4.
Trained by Scotty Schulhofer for Jeanne Vance, Lemon Drop Kid, a son of Lane's End's leading sire, Kingmambo, has earned more than $2.8 million in his three years of racing.

Lemon Drop Kid, who won the Belmont and Travers Stakes last year and who is a leading candidate for Horse of the Year this year, will stand at Lane's End Farm in Kentucky when he is retired after the Breeders' Cup Classic Nov. 4.
Trained by Scotty Schulhofer for Jeanne Vance, Lemon Drop Kid, a son of Lane's End's leading sire, Kingmambo, has earned more than $2.8 million in his three years of racing.
His victories also include the 1998 Belmont Futurity and this year's Brooklyn, Suburban and Whitney Handicaps.
